Hi Ron. No photo attached in the message I received. Please send to surfson@...
Bob

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all -
>
> Silly thing to be pondering late night before driving to Tampa, but...I'm curious about a red
lacquer attribution on a little hirazukuri ko-wakizashi that's here. It looks like it's an
attribution to Shintogo Kuni--- (not mitsu?) and the ura seems to be a Honami inscription.
Anybody care to translate this inscription tonight??? Poor sword has been sandpapered but is
in interesting kinko fitted mounts. If not Kunimitsu, who then??? Just a last ditch exercise
that would be nice to solve.
>
> Ron
> STL
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.subject: Emailing: Shintogo
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - Silly thing to be pondering late night before driving to Tampa, but...I m curious about a red lacquer attribution on a little hirazukuri ko-wakizashi
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

Silly thing to be pondering late night before driving to Tampa, but...I'm curious about a red lacquer attribution on a little hirazukuri ko-wakizashi that's here. It looks like it's an attribution to Shintogo Kuni--- (not mitsu?) and the ura seems to be a Honami inscription. Anybody care to translate this inscription tonight??? Poor sword has been sandpapered but is in interesting kinko fitted mounts. If not Kunimitsu, who then??? Just a last ditch exercise that would be nice to solve.

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
